title: From toasted to roasted: Trump wines sales in military cantonments invite flak
content: US military stores are reportedly selling Trump-branded wines, sparking ethical concerns despite official claims of legality. This incident echoes broader accusations of the Trump family's self-enrichment, including a crypto venture with Pakistan that critics allege strained US-India ties. Lavish White House events during a government shutdown also drew sharp criticism for insensitivity.

title: Mumbai: Man assaults 3 Cooper Hospital doctors after mother‚Äôs death
content: Chaos unfolded at Cooper Hospital following the death of a patient, as the medical staff faced aggression from the deceased's son, leading to an assault on two doctors and an intern. In response, many resident doctors have chosen to go on mass casual leave, voicing their frustrations and fears.

title: Bengaluru rapido driver who 'tried to grab woman's legs' arrested
content: A 28-year-old Rapido bike-taxi driver was apprehended in Bengaluru for allegedly sexually harassing a 20-year-old woman during a ride. The victim shared her ordeal on Instagram, detailing how the driver attempted to grab her legs. Police initiated a case after her complaint, and the accused claims he was trying to rub his back.

title: Jaipur horror: Man bludgeoned to death with grinding stone, pestle by enraged wife
content: A 40-year-old technician was allegedly murdered by his wife in Jaipur during a domestic dispute. The 32-year-old accused reportedly used a grinding stone and pestle to strike her husband on the head, leading to his death. Neighbours alerted by the commotion transported the victim to the hospital, where he was declared dead on arrival.

title: Asia Cup: ‚ÄòFeels great to finally get to touch the trophy,‚Äô says Suryakumar Yadav
content: The Indian team had earlier declined to receive the Asia Cup winner‚Äôs trophy from PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, who also serves as the Asian Cricket Council chairperson, citing his anti-India stance. Efforts are now underway to resolve the trophy dispute, with representatives from both cricket boards having met recently in Dubai.

title: Canada‚Äôs $1.2 bn plan to woo H-1B visa holders; reveals new immigration plan
content: Canada is rolling out a new immigration strategy, aiming to attract over 1,000 top researchers with a $1.2 billion investment. The nation plans to welcome 380,000 permanent residents annually from 2026-2028.  An accelerated pathway for H-1B visa holders is also in the works, potentially drawing skilled professionals from the US.

title: Babar Azam hits mega milestone! Joins Viv, Azharuddin and Cook in exclusive list
content: Pakistan‚Äôs star batter Babar Azam added another feather to his illustrious career by completing 15,000 international runs during the third ODI against South Africa on Saturday. The milestone came in the series decider at Iqbal Stadium, Faisalabad, making Babar only the fifth Pakistani to achieve the landmark.

title: Pune man strangles wife, burns body in iron box; read crime novels before murder
content: A Pune businessman, inspired by crime fiction, meticulously planned and executed his wife's murder after suspecting an affair. He strangled her, cremated the body in a custom iron box, and scattered the ashes. Inconsistencies in his statements and call records ultimately led to his arrest, unraveling his chilling plot.

title: Death at dawn: 23-year-old dies as car rams parked truck in Ahmedabad; 2 women injured
content: A tragic early morning accident on SG Road claimed the life of 23-year-old Aryan Batra after his speeding car collided with a stationary truck. Two 21-year-old women, passengers in Batra's car, were seriously injured, with one remaining unconscious. Police are investigating the circumstances, including the direction of travel and potential party attendance.

title: Swatch exits top Swiss index: Maker of Omega, Tissot hit; China sales blamed
content: Swatch Group will be removed from the Swiss Leader Index (SLI) on December 22 due to declining market capitalization and trading volumes. This demotion follows a significant drop in sales, particularly from China, and increased competition from smartwatches. The move underscores broader challenges in the luxury goods sector.

title: Tampa tragedy: Speeding car fleeing police ploughs into crowd; four dead, 11 injured
content: A speeding car fleeing police crashed into a crowd outside a Tampa bar, killing four and injuring eleven. The driver, Silas Sampson, was attempting to evade law enforcement after street racing. This tragic incident has prompted renewed discussion on police pursuit policies.

title: Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal welcome baby boy; Karan Johar extends his wishes
content: Bollywood stars Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal have joyfully welcomed their first child, a baby boy, into the world. The news was met with widespread congratulations from friends, family, and industry colleagues, including filmmaker Karan Johar. Vicky's brother, Sunny Kaushal, expressed his excitement about becoming an uncle, while Vicky's father, Sham Kaushal, shared his profound gratitude for the blessings.

title: ‚ÄòNot about compensation‚Äô: Twitter founder defends Musk‚Äôs $1Tn pay; quotes Tesla‚Äôs old post
content: Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey has publicly supported Tesla CEO Elon Musk's proposed $1 trillion pay package. Dorsey stated the compensation is about ensuring a principled engineering approach for the company's future. This support comes as Tesla shareholders prepare to vote on the package at their annual general meeting today, November 6.

title: ‚ÄòWill be back‚Äô: PM Modi wraps up Bihar campaign; warns against ‚Äòjungle raj‚Äô return
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi concluded his Bihar election campaign with a confident address, promising to return for the NDA government's swearing-in ceremony. He highlighted welfare schemes, women's empowerment, and development initiatives, while also taking swipes at opposition leaders and their past governance.

title: 4-day school week gets community nod as Missouri voters back pilot districts
content: Two Missouri school districts, Independence and Hallsville, have overwhelmingly won voter approval to continue their four-day school weeks. This marks a significant shift under a new law requiring public consent for non-rural districts. The move is seen as a boost for teacher recruitment and retention, with educators citing improved work-life balance and planning time.

title: Sussanne Khan pens emotional tribute to mom Zarine Khan: ‚ÄòYou took our hearts‚Äô
content: Zarine Khan, wife of veteran actor Sanjay Khan and mother to Sussanne and Farah Khan Ali, passed away at 81. Her daughters shared deeply emotional tributes, remembering her grace, love, and as their guiding light. Zarine Khan's funeral was conducted according to Hindu traditions, attended by close family and friends.

title: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs ‚Äògoodbye‚Äô text hours before death highlights NFL crisis
content: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs death at 24 has forced the NFL to confront a serious mental health crisis. Police confirmed the Dallas Cowboys defensive end died by an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound after alarming messages to family. Coaches, teammates, and fans are grieving as dispatch audio reveals the severity of his final hours. Full details inside.

title: Klay Thompson apologises to Megan Thee Stallion after airport pickup mishap
content: Dallas Mavericks star Klay Thompson went viral for his heartfelt apology and remorse after arriving late to pick up girlfriend Megan Thee Stallion from the airport. He presented her with flowers, expressing genuine regret, which fans found "adorably human." The couple's authentic connection continues to charm audiences as they both thrive in their careers.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife Lauren Kyle drops ‚ÄòOilers Collection 03‚Äô racing-inspired line
content: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, has unveiled "Oilers Collection 03," a new capsule inspired by classic motorsport style. The collection blends the Oilers' iconic colors with high-end streetwear and automotive aesthetics, drawing from vintage racing suits and team heritage. Kyle shared a preview on Instagram, highlighting the performance-driven fashion.

title: Virat Kohli had Sachin Tendulkar, who was there with Babar Azam?‚Äô: Azam Khan's bold remark
content: Pakistan cricketer Azam Khan has drawn a comparison between Babar Azam‚Äôs impact on Pakistan cricket and Virat Kohli‚Äôs influence on Indian cricket, highlighting how Babar transformed Pakistan‚Äôs image from a team known mainly for its fast bowlers to one celebrated for batting excellence ‚Äî despite not having the same level of support that Kohli enjoyed during his rise.

title: Watch: Railways employee filmed by passenger throwing garbage from moving train
content: A Railways employee was filmed discarding garbage from a moving train, leading to his immediate dismissal. The incident, captured on video by a passenger, sparked public outrage and renewed concerns about waste management within Indian Railways. The railway authorities have taken swift action, imposing penalties and initiating counseling for staff to prevent future occurrences.

title: November 9: Best time today, as per zodiac sign
content: Hindu astrology emphasizes Shubh Muhurat, auspicious times for new beginnings, believed to invite positive energy and divine blessings. November 9, 2025, falls within the sacred Margashirsha month, dedicated to Lord Vishnu, making it a spiritually significant day. Astrologer Vishal Bhardwaj outlines specific auspicious times for various zodiac signs on this day for different activities.

title: Indian-origin man questioned in Chicago; governor says ‚Äòbecause of his skin color‚Äô
content: An Indian-origin US citizen, working for Illinois DOT, was questioned by masked federal agents about his immigration status and New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani. Governor Pritzker condemned the incident as potential racial profiling. The Department of Homeland Security denied the agents were from ICE or CBP, but the event caused local alarm and school lockdowns.

title: Young Indians increasingly using credit for upskilling & career advancement, finds survey
content: A new wave of financial behaviour is emerging among young Indians as credit transforms from a sign of deficit to a tool for self-investment. According to an mPokket Financial Services survey, over 63% of respondents said credit improved their finances, with many using it for education, career growth, and upskilling‚Äîreflecting a shift toward purpose-driven borrowing in India‚Äôs evolving job market.

title: Priyanka accuses PM Modi of undermining dignity of office
content: Priyanka Gandhi criticized PM Modi's "katta" remarks as unbecoming of his office and accused the NDA of bribing women voters with Rs10,000. She urged voters to choose change to keep families together, highlighting job losses due to privatization and paper leaks, and likened the INDIA bloc's fight to Mahatma Gandhi's struggle for rights.

title: Patrick Mahomes speechless as Brittany joins star-studded NWSL board
content: Brittany Mahomes has joined a star-studded advisory board for the NWSL, focusing on marketing, branding, and player initiatives starting in 2026. This appointment signifies a major cultural shift for the Kansas City Current and women's sports. Patrick Mahomes silently supported the announcement, highlighting Kansas City's growing influence in both men's and women's professional sports.

title: 'Condemn what happened': Nadigar Sangam reacts to YouTuber's question on Gouri G. Kishan
content: The South Indian Artists' Association strongly condemns a YouTuber's indecent question posed to actress Gouri G. Kishan. Association president Nassar highlighted the film industry's respect for women and the need to protect their dignity. He called for strict action against individuals misusing social media platforms and posing as journalists. Measures will be taken to prevent such incidents in the future.

title: Big revelation! When Shah Rukh Khan stepped in to save Cheteshwar Pujara's career
content: Pujara‚Äôs wife, Puja, recalled the incident in her book 'The Diary of a Cricketer‚Äôs Wife': ‚ÄúDestiny impelled him to dash heedlessly to a ball for a catch that was never there; and the result: a ruptured anterior cruciate ligament, an impending surgery and a temporarily halted cricketing career ‚Äî all without playing a single game for KKR.‚Äù

title: Stefon Diggs Reacts After Being Named Father of Aileen Lopera‚Äôs Child
content: New England Patriots star Stefon Diggs faces paternity claims from Aileen Lopera, with a test confirming him as the father, while also expecting a child with Cardi B. Amidst this, Diggs shared a cryptic social media quote about fate. DJ Akademiks also alleged Diggs fathered a child with K‚Äôyanna Barber.

title: Murmu trip to Botswana sparks cheetah hope
content: In a thrilling development for wildlife conservation, India is poised to receive between 8 to 10 cheetahs from Botswana, with the official reveal anticipated during President Murmu‚Äôs upcoming visit. This strategic move builds on the success of earlier translocations from Namibia and South Africa.

title: Sunita Ahuja says she wouldn‚Äôt want Govinda as husband again: ‚ÄòNot a good spouse
content: Govinda‚Äôs wife, Sunita Ahuja, who is known for her frank and unfiltered personality, recently got candid about her marriage and also reflected on her husband‚Äôs past mistakes, her journey as a star‚Äôs wife, and why she doesn‚Äôt want Govinda as her husband in the next life.

title: Bars will be liable if customers are caught drunk driving in Gurgaon
content: Gurgaon bars and restaurants are now legally responsible for preventing drunk driving, with owners facing accountability if patrons are caught under the influence. This directive, aimed at curbing road accidents and fatalities, mandates staff to monitor customers, arrange alternative transport, and prohibit intoxicated individuals from driving. The move seeks to enhance road safety and reduce the burden on police checkpoints.

title: Indiana rallies to stay unbeaten in 'improbable' win
content: No. 2 Indiana scores with 36 seconds remaining to avoid its first loss of the season and beat Penn State 27-24.

title: Elko bristles at past, urges 9-0 Aggies to 'finish'
content: Texas A&M keeps defying its recent history of weak finishes, scoring another road win and moving to 9-0 for the first time since 1992 with Saturday's 38-17 rout of Missouri.

title: Boozer twins start strong in debut for No. 6 Duke
content: Cameron and Cayden Boozer thrived in their freshman debut at Duke, with Cameron going for 25 points, 8 rebounds and 5 assists in a blowout win.

title: Messi's brace leads Miami to 1st playoff series win
content: Lionel Messi's first-half brace propelled Inter Miami to a 4-0 victory over Nashville SC to advance in the MLS playoffs for the first time in club history.

title: Kawhi to miss 'next few games' with ankle sprain
content: Kawhi Leonard will miss "the next few games" due to a sprained ankle but the injury doesn't seem serious, according to coach Tyronn Lue.

title: Texas Tech LB Rodriguez flashes a Heisman pose
content: Texas Tech linebacker Jacob Rodriguez struck a Heisman Trophy pose during another dominating defensive performance by the ninth-ranked Red Raiders, leading his club to a stifling 29-7 Big 12 victory over previously undefeated No. 8 BYU on Saturday.

title: Ducks ignore 'outside noise,' improve CFP hopes
content: Atticus Sappington kicked a 39-yard field goal with 3 seconds left, and the No. 6 Oregon Ducks escaped with an 18-16 victory over the Iowa Hawkeyes on a rainy Saturday night in a Big Ten matchup that featured two of the country's top scoring defenses.

title: Eagles' Brown in line to play Monday vs. Packers
content: Philadelphia veteran receiver A.J. Brown, who missed his club's Week 8 game against the New York Giants with a hamstring injury, has no injury designation and is in line to play on Monday night in the Eagles' game against the Green Bay Packers.

content: USC got tricky with its jersey numbers for a fake punt, Texas Tech fans made it to "College GameDay" after a wedding and more from Week 11.

content: Will J.J. McCarthy work more outside the pocket? How will Sauce Gardner fare in his Colts debut? Upset brewing in Patriots-Bucs? Here's what to know for Week 10.

title: Chaotic Man United vs. Spurs finale another roller coaster of emotions for fans
content: Tottenham fans thought their team had come from behind to beat Manchester United, only to concede a 96th-minute equalizer in a 2-2 draw.

content: A trip to Sombor, Serbia, paints a portrait of the elusive Nuggets star by the people who know him best.

content: Well, things escalated quickly. Which teams made the best -- and worst -- moves before the NFL trade deadline? We're making sense of all the action.

title: üí∞ Best fits for top MLB free agents
content: Free agency starts at 5 p.m. ET Thursday. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: ‚öæ Sources: Japanese home run king Murakami posts
content: Japanese star third baseman Munetaka Murakami, who owns the single-season home run record for a Japanese player in Nippon Professional Baseball, is entering the posting system for MLB teams, sources told ESPN.

title: üìà Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Bama top CFP ranking
content: In the first rankings of the College Football Playoff, coach Ryan Day and unbeaten Ohio State topped the list, followed by Big Ten foe Indiana at No. 2 with Texas A&M third and Alabama landing at four.

title: ‚öæ Former MLB star Strawberry pardoned by Trump
content: President Donald Trump has pardoned former MLB great Darryl Strawberry, the 1983 NL Rookie of the Year and an eight-time All-Star, of tax evasion and drug charges dating back to the latter part of his playing career.

title: Arsenal needed to beat Chelsea, but poor officiating made it hard
content: Arsenal-Chelsea should have been a WSL spectacle. But it was ruined by some poor officiating decisions.

title: Are trade talks next? Latest NBA intel on futures of Ja, Zion, Trae
content: How close are the Grizz, Pelicans and Hawks to trading their stars? Is Giannis Watch over? Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst have the latest.

content: Can Vergil Ortiz Jr. win his first world title? Will Erickson Lubin test Ortiz and finally win the "big fight"?

title: Jake Paul's new fight wish list: Canelo Alvarez, Ryan Garcia, more
content: Jake Paul has fought six fighters off his wish list of 12. Now the YouTuber-turned-boxer shares a new list.

title: Madhya Pradesh school gets steel plates after video with children eating on newspapers sparks outrage
content: The video of food served on newspapers went viral on Tuesday (November 4), following which the authorities  cancelled the contract of the self-help group responsible for preparing meals

title: Mother of late BRS MLA Gopinath seeks inquiry into son‚Äôs death, alleges negligence and foul play
content: Mahananda Kumari further alleged that she was denied access to her son while he was in intensive care at AIG Hospital

title: State urges CCI to lift curbs on cotton procurement to help ryots
content: Minister for Agriculture Tummala Nageswara Rao asks CCI CMD L.K. Gupta to increase max. moisture content to 20%, per acre cotton purchase to 12 quintals

title: NGT directs Rajasthan government to rehabilitate villagers affected by mining
content: The NGT‚Äôs order includes ‚Çπ50,000 each to villagers whose houses have been damaged as per an official list and ‚Çπ20,000 each to villagers as per another list for environmental damage and health impacts

title: Darjeeling schools exempted from singing West Bengal State anthem in assemblies: Gorkhaland administration
content: The West Bengal government, on November 4, issued a notification that Rabindranath Tagore song ‚ÄòBanglar Mati, Banglar Jol‚Äô  will be sung in morning assembly in schools across the State

title: Erstwhile BBMP‚Äôs plans on strays in spotlight now
content: To ramp up the Animal Birth Control (ABC) drive, the BBMP had proposed setting up veterinary hospitals with adequate facilities in all its zones

title: The monsoon beats a menacing retreat in Marathwada
content: It has been a month since Marathwada, a drought-prone region, was ravaged by unprecedented floods, leaving 108 people dead and over 45,000 in shelters. Marginal farmers, who form at least 75% of the area‚Äôs farmer population, are the worst affected, many trapped under the burden of debt. Vinaya Deshpande Pandit visits Beed district to find that as farmers wait for government-promised aid, the rabi sowing has been disrupted with the damaged soil and retreating monsoon

title: Climate change, imbalance in fertiliser use kill soil‚Äôs organic carbon: ICAR study
content: Team of scientists study more than two lakh soil samples to find out impact of loss of natural soil carbon, suggests measures to Governments to address situation

title: Exercise Trishul to boost integrated readiness across multiple domains: Defence Ministry
content: The training will culminate in a mega combat exercise, validating precision-targeting and multi-domain coordination.

title: Enforcement Directorate¬†raids¬†multiple locations in West Bengal in¬†trafficking racket¬†case
content: Over ‚Çπ1 crore cash, luxury cars, and digital evidence seized; investigation reveals large-scale exploitation of women

content: What will happen to those living in traditional forest habitats within tiger reserves? What are they guaranteed under the Forest Rights Act? Why did a directive from the National Tiger Conservation Authority prompt the setting up of a new policy framework?

content: After being pulled out of the wreckage, Dharmendra Singh was shifted to a private hospital in Kalaburagi city for further treatment

title: Students put ideas to test as State School Science Festival opens in Palakkad
content: A special segment for differently abled students showcased their talents, turning the fair into a fresh, inspiring experience.

title: Central teams laud healthcare services in Chittoor, Parvathipuram Manyam districts
content: Teams note better public response to chronic disease screening, appreciate support for ASHAs, and suggest steps to improve health infrastructure

content: Journalist¬†Rana¬†Ayyub, who¬†has been subject to online harassment for years, speaks of the latest threat she‚Äôs facing

title: Cong fighting same battle against 'Modi empire' that Mahatma Gandhi fought against British: Priyanka
content: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra addresses back-to-back rallies in Bihar‚Äôs Katihar, Bhagalpur, and Purnea districts, jabs the NDA government over ‚Äòkatta‚Äô remarks, unemployment and more

title: Implementation of projects signed in ‚ÄòRising Rajasthan‚Äô being expedited
content: The three-day investment summit held in Jaipur from December 9 to 11, 2024 had facilitated the signing of MoUs worth ‚Çπ35 lakh crore.

title: Congress chief rubbishes claims of NDA victory in Bihar, cites ‚Äò400-plus rhetoric‚Äô ahead of LS polls
content: Kharge insisted that ‚Äúall was not well‚Äù in the BJP-led coalition, as there were doubts that Nitish Kumar, the JD(U) president and longest-serving Chief Minister, would be backed for another term in office

title: What is your ‚Äògut feeling‚Äô about mental health?
content: Experts at Manotsava, the mental health festival under way in Bengaluru, spoke about emerging research that is validating the traditional wisdom that good digestion is the foundation of both physical and emotional health

title: 88,000 ‚Äòinfiltrators sent back‚Äô during 10-year UPA regime, claims Digvijaya Singh
content: Criticising the ongoing second phase of SIR taking place across many States, including Madhya Pradesh, the Congress leader says the BJP-led Centre has only been able to find 2,400 infiltrators for repatriation in 11 years

title: New vessel rules to promote workers‚Äô cooperatives in fishing sector
content: The rules will ‚Äònot only facilitate deep-sea fishing but will also contribute to enhancing seafood exports by emphasising value addition, traceability, and certification‚Äô, the Union Fisheries Ministry said

title: Skill development institute to be set up at an investment of ‚Çπ100 crore
content: The institute is being set up to help students and job aspirants to develop their skills, considering the proximity to major industrial units in Kalamassery like FACT, TCC, BPCL, and Cochin Shipyard Limited, says Kerala Industries Minister

title: Buddha relics reach Bhutan as India‚Äôs ‚Äògift‚Äô for Global Peace Prayer Festival
content: Thousands of Buddhists from the Himalayan country and beyond have converged for mass prayers for peace on earth

title: In Bihar‚Äôs villages, microfinance has changed from a promise of empowerment to a deadly debt trap
content: Bihar holds 15% of India‚Äôs microfinance portfolio, the largest among States; with outstanding loans at ‚Çπ57,712 crore, those caught in the debt trap have little hope that the ongoing election will change their plight

title: ‚Çπ21-crore detailed project report prepared for development of Kapavaram Buddhist site
content: The State will seek financial support from the Ministry of Culture under the Scheme of Financial Assistance for the Development of Buddhist/Tibetan Culture and Art, says Rajanagaram MLA

title: Centre undermining local languages to prioritise Sanskrit: Hampana
content: ‚ÄòThe Union government is pushing for One Language, One Nation, One Election while systematically stifling people‚Äôs languages. A major portion of the language funding is being used to promote Sanskrit alone‚Äô

title: Poor can‚Äôt access justice until they are aware of their rights, says PM Modi
content: At the inauguration of a conference on legal aid delivery mechanisms, PM Modi stresses the importance of legal awareness and justice delivery in a language understood by the recipient

title: Digital abuse against women journalists cannot be normalised as part of ‚Äòonline discourse‚Äô: CJI-designate Justice Surya Kant
content: ‚ÄòThese perpetrators, instead of engaging with their actual work or the opinions expressed by women journalists, utilise these methods of ‚Äòonline violence‚Äô to belittle, induce fear, and discredit them professionally,‚Äô Justice Kant said, speaking at the Indian Women‚Äôs Press Corps

content: The civic body pioneered the use of DHPPiL, proposed to set up veterinary hospitals, introduced feeding programmes

title: In Seemanchal, voters fight poverty, migration and floods
content: Failing to form an alliance with the Opposition, Owaisi‚Äôs AIMIM is all out to dent INDIA bloc‚Äôs vote share. However, it is unlikely to make much impact despite the significant Muslim population in Seemanchal. The BJP is making an attempt to change the mood by raising the issue of alleged infiltration.

title: Over 70% of India‚Äôs prisoners have not yet been found guilty: SC judge
content: Of the 74% undertrials, only 7.91% utilised legal aid available to them, as most of the accused don‚Äôt even know that they have a right to free legal aid, says Justice Vikram Nath during release of NALSAR report

title: GBA chief instructs officials to speed up pothole-filling works; deploys more teams
content: Maheshwar Rao directs officials to give top priority to pending potholes on arterial and sub-arterial roads

title: Littering mars Kozhikode beach food street soon after opening
content: Videos of garbage piling up went viral a day after launch, with Corporation officials attributing the mess to a lack of civic sense among visitors despite adequate waste management measures

title: APCRDA gets ‚Çπ7,500 crore loan for development of Amaravati LPS villages
content: Infrastructure works related to basic amenities, development and others in 29 villages will commence on November 21, says MA&UD Minister

title: Ghana invites Singareni to invest in its mining sector
content: Singareni CMD agrees to send a delegation to the African country soon to explore business opportunities

title: Special operation against red sandalwood smugglers soon, says Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan
content: Calling for an end to the illegal trade voluntarily, he says the government will soon seize the assets of four kingpins involved in the clandestine activity

title: A night of horrors
content: The gruesome events that unfolded in Coimbatore on the night of November 2 and early the next day, and the harrowing experience of a young couple in love, have shocked the nation. Wilson Thomas examines the sequence of events and follows up on the action taken since.

title: Mother Eliswa Vakayil, first nun of Kerala‚Äôs Catholic Church, declared Blessed
content: The declaration, made 112 years after her death, was attended by thousands of devotees, clergy and representatives of different religious orders

title: In final campaign push, PM urges voters to keep away ‚Äòjungle raj‚Äô for Bihar‚Äôs development
content: Home Minister Amit Shah promises the people that the government would make Bihar flood-free and the rivers coming from Nepal that cause destruction would be connected to those rivers to channel the floodwater to the farmers‚Äô fields

title: ED attaches eight more properties worth ‚Çπ67 crore in PFI case
content: The Enforcement Directorate previously attached assets worth ‚Çπ61.98 crore through nine orders, confirmed by the Adjudicating Authority under the PMLA, bringing the total attachments to ‚Çπ129 crore

title: ADGP visits Belagavi hospital, enquires about health of policemen injured in stone pelting
content: Additional Director-General of Police (Law and Order)¬†Hitendra R. on Saturday visited a private hospital in Belagavi to enquire about the health of police personnel who were injured in the stone-pelting incident near Hattaragi toll booth in Hukkeri taluk of Belagavi district

title: 2 Of India's Most Wanted Gangsters Arrested In Georgia, US, To Be Deported
content: Indian security agencies achieved major success as they arrested two of the country's most wanted gangsters, who have been operating abroad.

title: Ajit Pawar's Son Will Need To Pay Rs 42 Crore To Scrap Land Deal Amid Row
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said action in the Pune land deal case is being taken as per law and there is no question of saving anybody.

title: Green Tribunal Orders Crackdown On 1,700 Industries Dumping Waste In Ganga, Yamuna
content: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has directed the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) and state pollution regulators across Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana and Bihar to take "prompt action" against more than 1,700 Grossly Polluting Industries

title: Uttarakhand University Giving Extra Marks For Attending PM Modi's Event? A Fact-Check
content: The viral notice, which appears to be issued by the Dev Bhoomi Uttarakhand University, asks all B.Tech CSE and specialisation (2nd year) and BCA (2nd year) students to attend the event.

title: Pak Amends Constitution, Gives Asim Munir Key Role After Op Sindoor Drubbing
content: Pakistan on Saturday brought in a Constitutional amendment to create a new post of chief of defence forces to ensure greater coordination and unified command among the three services.

title: RSS Chief Says Muslims, Christians "Descendants Of Same Ancestors"
content: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh chief Mohan Bhagwat on Saturday said that Hindus are "responsible" for Bharat, asserting that the RSS aims to organise Hindu society for the glory of the nation, not for power.

title: "Bhaiya Mat Karo": Woman In Bengaluru Says Rapido Rider Tried To Grab Her Legs
content: A Rapido bike taxi rider in Bengaluru has been arrested and charged for allegedly trying to grab a woman passenger's legs during a ride in the city, police said.

title: Man Fires Shots At Border Patrol Agents In Chicago During Immigration Raid
content: A man in Chicago fired shots at US Border Patrol agents during an immigration enforcement operation on Saturday, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) said, but the Chicago Police Department said it did not find anyone injured.

title: "As If Congress Is Interested": Minister On "Shortened" Winter Session Charge
content: Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju has hit back at Jairam Ramesh over his jibe at the government over the duration of the winter session of Parliament.

title: ISIS Recruiter, Rapist, Criminals Seen Using Phones, Watching TV Inside Bengaluru Jail
content: Allegations of major security lapses and preferential treatment at Bengaluru's Parappana Agrahara Central jail have surfaced after videos showed notorious inmates, including an ISIS recruiter, using mobile phones and watching television.

title: Ahmed Al-Sharaa Becomes 1st Syrian President To Visit US, Will Meet Trump Tomorrow
content: Syria's President Ahmed al-Sharaa arrived in the United States on Saturday for a landmark official visit, his country's state news agency reported, a day after Washington removed him from a terrorism blacklist.

title: 6 Killed, Over 700 Injured In Tornado In Brazil
content: A tornado killed at least six people and injured around 750 as it destroyed most of a town in southern Brazil, authorities said Saturday.

title: Freedom To Choose Life Partner Intrinsic Part Of Personal Liberty: Court
content: Freedom to choose a life partner is an intrinsic part of personal liberty and privacy under the Constitution and family or community cannot obstruct the choice of two consenting adults who decide to marry.

title: Will Be Back In Bihar For New NDA Government's Swearing-In: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wound up his campaign for Bihar assembly polls on Saturday, the penultimate day for canvassing for the second and final phase, claiming that people have given the opposition INDIA bloc a "65-volt jhatka" in the first leg.

title: Stray Dogs Bite 40 People In 2 Days In Madhya Pradesh's Damoh District
content: Stray dogs have bitten at least 40 persons over two days in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district, including 35 attacks by just two canines, officials said on Saturday.

title: 4-Year-Old Sleeping Next To Grandmother Kidnapped, Raped Near Kolkata
content: A four-year-old girl was kidnapped late on Friday night while she was asleep next to her grandmother and then sexually abused in Hooghly near Kolkata, police said.

title: "Significant Risk": SEBI Warns Against Investing In Digital Gold Products
content: Markets regulator Sebi on Saturday warned investors against investing in digital or e-gold products, saying such instruments fall outside its regulatory framework and involve significant risks.

title: 6 Students Arrested For Consuming Ganja At Birthday Party In Hyderabad
content: Six students from the Culinary Academy of India (CAI) in Hyderabad were arrested for consuming ganja (weed) during a birthday party.

title: Student's Body Found, 2 Missing After Slipping Into Waterfall In Assam
content: Three first-year IT students went missing after they reportedly fell into a waterfall in Assam's Dima Hasao district, the police said.

title: Flights Halted At Nepal's Kathmandu Airport Due To Electric Problem
content: Flight operations were temporarily suspended at Kathmandu's Tribhuvan International Airport after problems occurred in the runway's lighting system on Saturday.

title: Giants' 'Vintage White,' Broncos' throwbacks lead NFL Week 10 uniforms
content: the new york Giants first wore the combination in 2016 as part of the NFL's color rush program . but it took a one-year hiatus in 2024 . it includes blue numbers with a red outline, similar to what the franchise wore .

title: Winter session from December 1 to 1 9; unusually truncated, says opposition
content: the winter session of parliament will be held from december 1 to 19 . the three-week session will have 15 sittings in all and is expected to be stormy as it comes in the midst of the election Commission's special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls .

title: BJP MLA Hans Raj faces Pocso FIR for sexual assault; denies charges

title: Prof Rajaraman, 'Pitamah' of India's computer science education, dies at 92
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines ‚Äî Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few ‚Äî  but is based out of Bengaluru, India‚Äôs science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. Read More

title: NHL Power Rankings: Every team's current pace vs. preseason projections

title: Why was Ja Morant suspended? What we know about the latest Grizzlies drama
content: grizzlies guard Ja Morant is frustrated with his joy for the game of basketball . the Grizzlies are frustrated, too, suspending Morant for a game over the weekend because of conduct detrimental to the team . morant missed the loss to the Toronto Raptors on Sunday, then had 18 points .

title: üèÄ The Bilas Index: The top 68 teams this season
content: the Bilas Index is the most powerful and consequential instrument of basketball wisdom and judgment known to humankind . it serves as much more than a guide or a road map to this men's college basketball season . the Bilastrator's immense and powerful brain is superior in processing basketball performance, potential and ability .

title: Don't be surprised if ... Lamar Jackson, Rashid Shaheed thrive down the stretch
content: Rashid Shaheed averaged 11.6 fantasy points, on pace for 83 receptions and 943 receiving yards . Shaheed was a reasonable, deep-league flex option who simply needed better quarterback play . he averaged an ordinary 11.3 yards per catch with QBs Spencer Rattler .

title: 13 more Week 10 games, 13 matchup previews: We have predictions, picks and wild stats

title: Projecting the CFP top 12: Who's No. 2?
content: the selection committee will decide who should be no. 2 on Tuesday night . a deeper dive into the statistics and r√©sum√©s of both undefeated teams will factor into their discussions . it might be a bigger debate than how far no. 7 BYU should fall this week .

title: Indiana's catch of the year, Oregon's last-second escape: The B1G stole the show in Week 11
content: the big Ten is the sport's chief exporter of cheese, beef and punts . it's not that the Big Ten doesn't have good games, necessarily . the drama often feels more "Masterpiece Theater" than "Alien vs. Predator"

title: The NFL at midseason: Separating the good, bad and ugly for all 32 teams
content: quarterback carousel spins in Arizona, New Orleans and San Francisco with injuries . quarterback jaxson Dart has impressed as a rookie QB in new york . the nfl is one of the strongest divisions halfway through the season . "get up" team reporters took part in a midseason reset .

title: Week 11 intel: Auburn fallout, Texas' moves and biggest visits
content: the recruiting trail has heated up this week as the clock ticks down on the 2026 class . Ohio State, Texas and Texas Tech are among the programs charging for late-cycle flips . the market for premium defensive tackles, led by fall decommits Danny Beale, Dylan Berymon and Emanuel Ruffin, is intensifying this month .
